content: In the fourth quarter, sales trends at both Vera Bradley and Pura Vida improved over prior quarters, with Vera Bradley total sales down just 1% and Pura Vida sales down less than 5% on a year-over-year basis. In January 2023, we further streamlined our corporate structure by eliminating the positions of Vera Bradley Brand President, Chief Creative Officer, and Chief Revenue Officer, and by adding the position of Chief Marketing Officer, designed to drive additional annual cost savings of approximately $2 million, add more focus on marketing and merchandising, and position the Company to deliver steady top and bottom-line growth. Vera Bradley direct segment revenues totaled $328.2 million this year, a 7.5% decrease from $354.9 million in the prior year. Vera Bradley Indirect segment revenues totaled $73.3 million, up 11.1% over $66 million last year, reflecting an increase in certain key account orders. Pura Vida segment revenues totaled $98.4 million, a 17.7% decrease from $119.6 million in the prior year. This year's gross profit totaled $257.2 million or 51.4% of net revenues, compared to $287.9 million or 53.3% of net revenues last year. SG&A expenses totaled $245.3 million, or 49.1% of net revenues compared to $258.8 million or 47.9% of net revenues in the prior year. For the fiscal year, consolidated operating profit was $12.3 million, or 2.5% of net revenues compared to $30.1 million or 5.6% of net revenues last year. Net capital spending of approximately $5 million compared to $8.2 million in the prior year, reflecting investments associated with new Vera Bradley Factory stores and technology and logistics enhancements.
